org.hl7.util
Class DatatypeAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  org.hl7.util.DatatypeAnalyzer

public class DatatypeAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object

Provides static methods to analyze a data value to understand what it is in terms of the HL7 data type specification. The HL7 data type specification and the Java SIG API are pretty exactly parallel, but there are some exceptions and corner cases which need to be considered. Note: we cannot figure out a complete description of the type as it was instantiated. The bindings of the TypeVariables cannot be recovered. Only classes that are declared to impement interfaces of bound generic types can be recovered. E.g., I can find that class Foo implements Bar { } has Bar's type variable bound to Baz, but I cannot figure out that Bar object ... .getClass() has Bar's type variable bound to Baz. So, we are stuck here.

Method Summary
static java.lang.String getTypeBase(ANY value)
          Figure out the basis of this value, which is the data type in case of simple data types and the generic type, such as SET, LIST, IVL, etc for parameterized types.
